content: tempest scarf by amy hanna above the clouds crochet if you have any questions or concerns regarding this pattern please get in touch via email abovethecloudscrochet@gmail com or instagram direct message @abovethecloudscrochet *scarfs pictured are single infinity made with loops and threads swirled ombré* this pattern is for personal use only pattern and photos are property of above the clouds crochet you are welcome to sell any finished products made using this pattern but please credit above the clouds crochet where possible distribution of this pattern in whole or in part is not allowed tempest scarf 1 © above the clouds crochet materials  any worsted weight yarn of your choosing o 200-240 yards for single infinity scarf o 250-300 yards for double infinity scarf  8 00mm crochet hook you can use any hook size you want personally i liked the softness and drape that a larger hook achieved  tapestry needle  scissors measurements for a single infinity scarf will wrap once continue with pattern repeat until piece measures 55 -65 in length before sewing ends together for a double infinity scarf will wrap twice continue with pattern repeat until piece measures 70 -80 in length before sewing ends together width 7 5 -8 5 abbreviations chain s = chain s st s = stitch s slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet skill level beginner pattern notes - this is a single row repeat making it a super quick make - multiples have been provided making it easy to adjust the width of your scarf as well as change up hook size and/or yarn weight - measurements have been provided below for both single infinity and double infinity sizes - gauge is not important for this pattern pattern instructions chain 28 or any multiple of 3+1 row 1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in fifth chain from hook *skip two chs double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next chain repeat from * until two chs remain skip one chain double_crochet in last turn row 2 chain 2 counts as first double_crochet skip next st double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next chain-1 space *skip two double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next chain-1 space repeat from * until last chain-1 space skip next st double_crochet in last st top of beginning chain from previous row turn repeat row 2 until scarf reaches desired length for either single infinity or double infinity scarf fasten_off leaving a long tail about 12-14 long for sewing fold piece in half and line up your first row with your last row using your long tail tapestry needle and preferred method of sewing sew two ends of scarf together i like using a whip stitch its quick tempest scarf 2 © above the clouds crochet and looks nice but you can use any method you like weave in all remaining ends and enjoy your soft new scarf *scarf pictured is a double infinity using caron cakes yarn* this pattern is for personal use only pattern and photos are property of above the
